Uses of Class
popt4jlib.OptimizerException

  • Packages that use OptimizerException 
    Package Description
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 1- and 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    popt4jlib
    popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.
    popt4jlib.BH
    Generalized Adaptive Basin Hopping
    popt4jlib.DE
    Differential Evolution Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.EA
    Evolutionary Algorithms Parallel Implementation
    popt4jlib.GA
    Genetic Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.GradientDescent
    Gradient-Descent Type Algorithms Parallel Implementation (suitable for real vector function optimization).
    popt4jlib.GradientDescent.stochastic
    Stochastic Gradient-Descent Type Algorithms Parallel Implementation (suitable for (deterministic or stochastic) real vector function optimization).
    popt4jlib.LocalSearch
    Local Search algorithms parallel implementation for combinatorial optimization problems.
    popt4jlib.MonteCarlo
    Monte-Carlo Search Parallel Implementation (aka random search)
    popt4jlib.neural
    Neural Network Related Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.PS
    Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.PS.FA
    Firefly Algorithm Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.SA
    Simulated Annealing Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    tests.sic.rnqt.nbin
    tests.sic.rnqt.nbin package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (R,nQ,T) facing stochastic demands that are distributed according to the Negative Binomial distribution (a compound Poisson distribution where customers arrive at intervals that are spaced according to the Poisson distribution, but their order quantities are logarithmically distributed instead of being always single unit demands) in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.
    tests.sic.rnqt.norm
    tests.sic.rnqt.norm package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (R,nQ,T) facing normally distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.
    tests.sic.sST.det
    tests.sic.sST.det package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run exact average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (R,nQ,T) facing deterministic demands with constant demand rate, in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.
    tests.sic.sST.poisson
    tests.sic.sST.poisson package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing Poisson distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

      void GLockingObservableObserverBase.notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will add the best solution found by the subject, in the _subjects' solutions map, to be later picked up by the first optimizer Thread spawned by this object.
      void GLockingObserverBase.notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will invoke the sub-class's implementation of the abstract notifyChangeProtected(subject) method (template method style).
      void ObserverIntf.notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
      called by a subject monitored when it changes its state.
      protected abstract void GLockingObserverBase.notifyChangeProtected(SubjectIntf subject)
      sub-classes must implement this method to actually act on the notification.
      void OptimizerIntf.setParams(java.util.HashMap params)
      set this object's parameters needed for the optimization process.

      PairSer OneDStepQuantumOptimizer.argmin(FunctionIntf f, VectorIntf x0, java.util.HashMap fparams, int varindex, double stepquantum, double lowerbound, double upperbound, int niterbnd, int multfactor, double ftol, int maxiterswithsamefunctionval, int maxnumfuncevals)
      computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound ≤ x_j ≤ upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.

      protected void AlternatingVariablesDescent.notifyChangeProtected(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will call its minimize() method, and add the result back into the subject object.

      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will call its minimize() method, and add the result back into the subject object.
      protected void FletcherConjugateGradientST.notifyChangeProtected(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will add the best solution found by the subject, in the _observers' solutions map.
      protected void PolakRibiereConjugateGradientST.notifyChangeProtected(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will set the best solution found by the subject, as the initial point to start the PRCG optimization process, and upon completion of the optimization process, it will add back the new solution to the subject by calling the subject's addIncumbent(this,sol) method.
